intro: Hemitelia obtusa var. bullata, commonly known as the bullate hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique varietal features, such as the bullate (blistered) texture of its leaves, make it a distinctive species within its genus.
